New Records: Zack Wheeler delivered another postseason gem with seven shutdown innings, allowing just one run.
Bryce Harper, Kyle Schwarber, and J.T. Realmuto homered, with Schwarber's homer being his fifth in the NLCS and 20th in the postseason.
Key Match Events: Bryson Stott hit an RBI single and Harper slid home in a collision with catcher Gabriel Moreno as part of a double steal that built a 2-0 lead in the first off Zac Gallen.
Schwarber’s 461-foot homer and Harper’s 444-foot homer were significant highlights of the game.
Pre-Game Insights: Philadelphia moved one win from its second straight World Series appearance after previously wasting late leads in consecutive one-run losses at Chase Field.
Post-Match Reflections: The series resumes Monday in Philadelphia, where the Phillies are 6-0 this postseason with 17 homers.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Phillies are 6-0 in the postseason with a strong performance in the series.
